Notes: The Mobile Municipal Archives, opened in 1983, collects official records of the city of Mobile, which was founded in 1702 and became an American municipality in 1814.  Holdings consist of approximately 7,000 cubic feet of municipal records dating from 1798.  These include maps, building plans, council and commission minutes, still pictures, executive correspondence, and tax records that document the development of one of the older municipalities in the United States.  Local newspapers, a reference collection on local history and urban studies, and microform copies of many early municipal records are also available.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
